comment.author: 22648179@N00
comment._content: Edith Kermit Carow Roosevelt, Pres. Theodore Roosevelt's second wife and first lady. Judging that this is from the same set as a photo of Mrs. Theodore Roosevelt Jr., it is no earlier than 1910. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edith_Roosevelt

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
No, that would be Mrs. Theodore Roosevelt, Junior -- wife of the former President's son. She was the former Eleanor Butler Alexander. They were wed on June 20, 1910. This photo was taken on June 17, 1913.

[Edith Kermit Carow Roosevelt would have been 52 in 1913.]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo, taken the same day, shows a woman identified as Mrs. Roosevelt at the race track, :
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3048512454/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: New York society bluebloods in attendance at the horse races at Belmont Park, on June 17, 1913. A story in the New York Times on the 18th reported the roster of winners that day: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9406E...
